"**Can 't You See**" is a song written by [Toy Caldwell](/wiki/Toy_Caldwell
"Toy Caldwell") of [The Marshall Tucker Band](/wiki/The_Marshall_Tucker_Band
"The Marshall Tucker Band"). The song was originally recorded by the band on
their 1973 debut album, _[The Marshall Tucker
Band](/wiki/The_Marshall_Tucker_Band_\(album\) "The Marshall Tucker Band
\(album\)")_ , and released as the album's first single. It was re-released in
1977 and peaked at number 75 on the _[Billboard](/wiki/Billboard_\(magazine\)
"Billboard \(magazine\)")_ [Hot 100](/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot
100").[2] Cover versions of "Can't You See" have charted for [Waylon
Jennings](/wiki/Waylon_Jennings "Waylon Jennings") (in 1976) and the [Zac
Brown Band](/wiki/Zac_Brown_Band "Zac Brown Band") with [Kid
Rock](/wiki/Kid_Rock "Kid Rock") (2010).

The song is featured in the 2001 films _[Blow](/wiki/Blow_\(film\) "Blow
\(film\)")_ and _[Scotland, PA](/wiki/Scotland,_PA "Scotland, PA")_ , the 2008
[Joshua Michael Stern](/wiki/Joshua_Michael_Stern "Joshua Michael Stern") film
_[Swing Vote](/wiki/Swing_Vote_\(2008_film\) "Swing Vote \(2008 film\)"),_ and
at least two commercials: one for [Busch Beer](/wiki/Busch_Beer "Busch Beer")
(2011) and one for tourism in [Gatlinburg,
Tennessee](/wiki/Gatlinburg,_Tennessee "Gatlinburg, Tennessee") (2012).

A live version is included as the final track on the band's 1975 album,
_[Searchin' for a Rainbow](/wiki/Searchin%27_for_a_Rainbow "Searchin' for a
Rainbow")_.

The original recording is noted for its [flute](/wiki/Flute "Flute")
introduction and ending, both by [Jerry Eubanks](/wiki/Jerry_Eubanks "Jerry
Eubanks").

##
Artistry[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Can%27t_You_See_\(The_Marshall_Tucker_Band_song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Artistry")]

The song, musically, is a cross between [country rock](/wiki/Country_rock
"Country rock") and [Southern rock](/wiki/Southern_rock "Southern rock").[1]

The lyrics are noted as being dark, reflecting heartache and "a man running as
far away as he can to begin the process of healing himself".[1]

"Can't You See" was covered by American country music artist [Waylon
Jennings](/wiki/Waylon_Jennings "Waylon Jennings") for his 1976 album _[Are
You Ready for the Country](/wiki/Are_You_Ready_for_the_Country "Are You Ready
for the Country")_. Jennings' version was released as the album's first single
in July 1976 and peaked at number 4 on the _Billboard_ [Hot Country
Singles](/wiki/Hot_Country_Songs "Hot Country Songs") chart.[3] It also
reached number 1 on the _[RPM](/wiki/RPM_\(magazine\) "RPM \(magazine\)")_
Country Tracks chart in Canada.[4]

### Other
versions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Can%27t_You_See_\(The_Marshall_Tucker_Band_song\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Other versions")]

  * [Hank Williams, Jr.](/wiki/Hank_Williams,_Jr. "Hank Williams, Jr.") covered "Can't You See" for his album _[Hank Williams, Jr. and Friends](/wiki/Hank_Williams,_Jr._and_Friends "Hank Williams, Jr. and Friends")_ in 1975.
  * [The Minglewood Band](/wiki/The_Minglewood_Band "The Minglewood Band") of the Canadian Maritimes covered "Can't You See" from their self-penned 1979 album, which became a much-requested staple of its live act.[5]
  * [The Charlie Daniels Band](/wiki/The_Charlie_Daniels_Band "The Charlie Daniels Band") covered "Can't You See" for their 1981 live album _Volunteer Jam VII_ and the 1999 album _Tailgate Party_.
  * [Alabama](/wiki/Alabama_\(band\) "Alabama \(band\)") covered "Can't You See" for their 1988 _[Alabama Live](/wiki/Alabama_Live "Alabama Live")_ album with [Jeff Cook](/wiki/Jeff_Cook "Jeff Cook") on lead vocals.
  * The [Zac Brown Band](/wiki/Zac_Brown_Band "Zac Brown Band"), along with [Kid Rock](/wiki/Kid_Rock "Kid Rock"), covered "Can't You See" on their 2010 live benefit album, _[Pass the Jar](/wiki/Pass_the_Jar:_Zac_Brown_Band_and_Friends_Live_from_the_Fabulous_Fox_Theatre_In_Atlanta "Pass the Jar: Zac Brown Band and Friends Live from the Fabulous Fox Theatre In Atlanta")_.
  * [Black Stone Cherry](/wiki/Black_Stone_Cherry "Black Stone Cherry") covered the song on their 2011 album _[Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea](/wiki/Between_the_Devil_and_the_Deep_Blue_Sea_\(Black_Stone_Cherry_album\) "Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea \(Black Stone Cherry album\)")_.
  * [Poison](/wiki/Poison_\(American_band\) "Poison \(American band\)") covered the song on their album _[Poison'd](/wiki/Poison%27d "Poison'd")_ in 2007.
  * [The Allman Brothers Band](/wiki/The_Allman_Brothers_Band "The Allman Brothers Band") covered the song live with [Kid Rock](/wiki/Kid_Rock "Kid Rock") in 2009.
  * [Sam Morrison Band](/w/index.php?title=Sam_Morrison_Band&action=edit&redlink=1 "Sam Morrison Band \(page does not exist\)") of Fullerton, CA covered the song in their self-titled CD around 2008 and later covered it again as a single in 2013.
  * Lost Possum covered "Can't You See" on their 2008 album, _Juggernaut_.
  * [Halfway to Gone](/wiki/Halfway_to_Gone "Halfway to Gone") covered "Can't You See" for the compilation album _[Sucking the 70s](/wiki/Sucking_the_70s "Sucking the 70s")_.
  * DJ Andy Beneker (DJ AndyB) covered the song in 2014 as a [mashup](/wiki/Mashup_\(music\) "Mashup \(music\)") with [Nelly's](/wiki/Nelly "Nelly") _[Country Grammar](/wiki/Country_Grammar "Country Grammar")_.
  * Vinyl Gypsies cover at the Chop Shop 08/27/2016
